page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This part of Eastern Scotland is a very fertile farming area, with cereal crops and potatoes predominating. The population within the area is, accordingly, thinly spread. Although there are two small villages, much of the population lives in farmhouse/cottage accomodation, since some 70% of the population has agriculture related employment. The surrounding countryside is gently rolling, but the cones of long extinct volcanoes, together with many strips of hardwood trees break up the landscape. Because we are near the sea (3km), and sheltered from the worst of the North and West winds, the winters are fairly mild, and the growing season long for this latitude.
